title: Possible Data Corruption Detected? I Just got force repatched yesterday?
body:
So the other day, people were complaining that mid-game they had been kicked out of the game and ended up having to patch their clients. A lot of people were frustrated when they were stuck with 33% or Scanning for X files. 

At the time i was offline at the time so i wasnt effected game wise but i did end up having to go through the Scanning for X files things. I knew that this wasnt a problem so i just waited it out. Once it had got to the downloading of the 'new' files it was a bit slow, i noticed that i had it scanning for files while i was downloading steam updates, so when the download commenced for the LoL Patcher, i was already downloading something else. Cause my net is shitty, (150kbs Max DL) both downloads took ages, alternating between 140-20 kbs download rates.

Now ive just attempted to launch LoL this morning and im met with a window, "Possible Data Corruption Detected", "Sorry we detected some possible data corruption in your installation...". 

I Have the option to say yes or no to "Repairing the effected files". My problem is, shouldnt they have been 'good' files if i just downloaded yesterday? i Didnt even play a game after it had downloaded the latest patch.

Should i repair and have to go through all the down loading again? or should i be right to leave em as is?

replies.body: Its a PC, %%%% happens, just repair it or face the the possibility of not being able to play LoL, common sense dude.
